required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Wellness Achieved Through Changing Habits (The WATCH Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Wellness Achieved Through Changing Habits (The WATCH Study)

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot, feasibility study is to investigate the effects of an acceptance-based therapy weight loss intervention on adolescents, to receive feedback about the program, and to learn about potential changes we could make to improve the program.

detailed_description.textblock:
Focus/writing groups will be conducted to assess perceived barriers and facilitators and identify components that the adolescents would like to see in a weight loss intervention in order to tailor an acceptance-based therapy (ABT) curriculum to adolescents.
Participants will attend 2 baseline visits and adolescents will participate in an ABT weight loss intervention.
The intervention will include 15 sessions over 6 months.
A post-treatment visit will occur.

primary_outcome.description: The recruitment strategy will be deemed "feasible" if approximately 15 participants are recruited within 8 weeks.
The attrition strategy will be deemed "feasible" if there is less than 50% attrition at the end of the 6-month intervention.

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of relative weight at pre- and post-treatment adjusted for participant age and sex

arm_group.description: Adolescent participants will attend sessions that include nutritional education and physical activity education and build skills in the areas of values clarification, mindfulness, self-regulation skills, acceptance of uncomfortable states, goal-setting, problem solving, and self-monitoring.

intervention.description: This includes 15 sessions that are each 90 minutes in length. Intervention sessions will be weekly for the first 2 months, bi-weekly for the next 2 months, and monthly for the last 2 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescent between ages 14-19 with overweight or obesity above the 85th percentile for sex and age as determined by CDC growth charts
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known pregnancy or plans to become pregnant in the next 2 years
- Plans to move out of the area in the next year
- Any condition prohibiting physical activity
- Autism
- An intellectual disability
- A diagnosis of cardiovascular disease or diabetes
- Have active cancer or cancer requiring treatment in the past 2 years
- Have active or chronic infections (e.g., HIV or TB)
- Have active kidney disease or lung disease
- An eating disorder or substance abuse disorder
- Having recently begun a course of or changed the dosage of any medications known to affect appetite or body composition
- Weight loss greater than or equal to 5% in the previous 6 months
- If they do not follow the study plan

overall_official.last_name: Michelle I Cardel, PhD, MS, RD

overall_contact_backup.last_name: Michelle I Cardel, PhD, MS, RD

investigator.last_name: Michelle I Cardel, PhD, MS, RD
